main.title: Distances in the $n$-dimensional space
content: Given $n$ points $P_1, P_2, P_3, \dots, P_n \in \mathbb{R}^{n-1}$, where each point $P_i$ represents the standard basis, i.e.: $$ P_i = e_i = (0, \dots, 0, 1, 0, \dots, 0) \in \mathbb{R}^{n-1} $$ (the entry 1 is at the $i$-th position)
\item Prove that the \textbf{points all have the same distance from each other}, i.e., for all $i \not= j$: $$ \parallel P_i - P_j \parallel = \sqrt{2} $$
\item Represent the points $P_1, \dots, P_n$ as column vectors of a matrix $A \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$.
\item \textbf{Additionally prove}: The points $P_1, \dots, P_n$ are \textbf{linearly independent} and form an \textbf{($n-1$)-dimensional simplex} in $\mathbb{R}^n$.
\item Compute the volume of the regular simplex in $\mathbb{R}^{n-1}$.
